recipes.name: Coq au Vin
recipes.instructions:
1. Prepare all ingredients required for coq au vin, ensuring everything is cleaned, chopped, and measured.
2. Season or marinate Coq according to the traditional flavors of the dish.
3. Heat oil, butter, or fat in a pot, skillet, or pan over medium heat until shimmering.
4. Add aromatics such as onions, garlic, herbs, or spices and sauté until fragrant and lightly browned.
5. Add the main ingredient and sear, sauté, or brown it to develop flavor.
6. Incorporate vegetables, broths, wine, tomatoes, or sauces depending on the style of the recipe.
7. Bring the mixture to a boil, then reduce heat to low and allow it to simmer for flavor development.
8. Stir occasionally, scraping the bottom to prevent sticking or burning.
9. Adjust seasoning using salt, herbs, pepper, spices, wine, or lemon juice to balance flavors.
10. Continue cooking until the main ingredient reaches ideal tenderness and the sauce thickens properly.
11. Add finishing elements such as fresh herbs, butter, olive oil, or garnishes.
12. Serve hot with side dishes traditionally paired with this recipe.

1. Prepare all ingredients required for fettuccine alfredo, ensuring everything is cleaned, chopped, and measured.
2. Season or marinate Fettuccine according to the traditional flavors of the dish.
3. Heat oil, butter, or fat in a pot, skillet, or pan over medium heat until shimmering.
4. Add aromatics such as onions, garlic, herbs, or spices and sauté until fragrant and lightly browned.
5. Add the main ingredient and sear, sauté, or brown it to develop flavor.
6. Incorporate vegetables, broths, wine, tomatoes, or sauces depending on the style of the recipe.
7. Bring the mixture to a boil, then reduce heat to low and allow it to simmer for flavor development.
8. Stir occasionally, scraping the bottom to prevent sticking or burning.
9. Adjust seasoning using salt, herbs, pepper, spices, wine, or lemon juice to balance flavors.
10. Continue cooking until the main ingredient reaches ideal tenderness and the sauce thickens properly.
11. Add finishing elements such as fresh herbs, butter, olive oil, or garnishes.
12. Serve hot with side dishes traditionally paired with this recipe.
